{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326009,"name":"Uri Goldstein","username":"uriGoldstein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/urigoldstein/{size}/180332_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T19:32:22.826Z","cooked":"

in the past two weeks, we had four occasions (3 of them during matches) that our canivore status light turnes red.

as i mentioned before 3 of those were during a match, and, one of them was when the robot was disabled.

did it happened to anyone? or do you know what can we do about it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T19:32:22.826Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":132,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":676.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457592,"topic_slug":"canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly","display_username":"Uri Goldstein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55701,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor of 5951"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly/457592/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor of 5951","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3326016,"name":"Qaanith Kamal","username":"Qaanith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T19:35:08.775Z","cooked":"

Check the USB-C side of the canivore. We’ve noticed that it often comes under strain and loosens the port on the canivore. I would put a new cable in and hot glue the cable to the component and u should be fine after that.

we already did that but it still happend

We had it happen at comp and replaced the canivore itself and hot glued the cable in. It’s possible that your usb-c port is already loose and it’s causing you to lose connection

We experienced similar issues, with multiple canivores. It is possible our rio2 side USB is faulty. Will be digging into it tonight.

In the meantime we lowered our CAN usage and ran everything on the Rio bus. This was a temporary solution while we competed this past weekend.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T19:40:13.674Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":17.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457592,"topic_slug":"canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55701,"username":"uriGoldstein","name":"Uri Goldstein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/urigoldstein/{size}/180332_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly/457592/7","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327767,"name":"Uri Goldstein","username":"uriGoldstein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/urigoldstein/{size}/180332_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T14:46:59.406Z","cooked":"

This is what ctre sent me:
My only guess is the roboRIO is disabling the USB port for some reason .

In the previous case of a team reporting this several years ago, they ended up switching from a USB camera to an Ethernet camera, and that issue never occurred again.

We also worked with NI to see if either of us could reproduce it, and both couldn’t.

If it happens again, pay attention to the LED pattern. Two slow red pulses means that the CANivore is NOT SEEING 5V on the USB.

We believe this is because the roboRIO has deactivated USB (USB suspend perhaps?).
Rapid red blink means USB 5V is present, but we don’t have a data connection, which could be a cabling issue.

I will continue updating, but maybe it will help you!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T14:46:59.406Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":46.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457592,"topic_slug":"canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly","display_username":"Uri Goldstein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55701,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor of 5951"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly/457592/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor of 5951","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327834,"name":"","username":"w4drone","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T16:14:34.644Z","cooked":"

we had a similar issue because our robot draws a whole lot of current, the roborio had shut down its USB power output and the canivore had to reboot a few times. The solution we used was powering it redundantly from both USB and MPM power

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T16:14:34.644Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457592,"topic_slug":"canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53254,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" Driver | Electrical Lead | "D1 Hater""},"post_url":"/t/canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly/457592/9","custom_user_title":" Driver | Electrical Lead | "D1 Hater"","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327836,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T16:18:47.898Z","cooked":"
w4drone:

the roborio had shut down its USB power output and the canivore had to reboot a few times.

I suspect this is possible, but do you have evidence of this occurring? Unsure if this exists in rio logs but I’ll be sure to check Saturday @Molly_Connolly @dh28567

Unfortunately, we are already redundantly powered off the PDH, so I’m not sure this is related to our issue.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T16:23:34.712Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":13.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457592,"topic_slug":"canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-status-light-turnes-red-randomly/457592/10","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327837,"name":"","username":"w4drone","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T16:20:43.187Z","cooked":"

yeah, i should be able to get logs at the meeting tonight. during the match, whenever too many things were running at once, drivebase would stop and take a second to go back online. when we gave it dual power from the MPM as well it stopped happening
